I do this strategy too and here is what I do:

1) I dont eat candy, chips or icecream. I keep a collection of healthy snacks like nuts, berries etc. I love it a lot now. So since recently I only snack here and there on healthy stuff and never crap again,

2) Unlearn the american plate size. I bet if you half your plate size you would still get plenty of nutrients.

3) Learn difference between hunger and desire to eat. One comes from necessity, the other from gluttony. Even if feels your stomach hurts a bit and is rumbling, if you ate a good meal the whining stomache. Eventualy it will literally feel good

4) Fasting does help in some way but not as other anons say. For me it resets dopamine and taste buds. If I eat too much sweet crap, healthy stuff tastes bad and I will not want it. After fasting, eating healthy stuff will again feel rewarding

posts.com:
Losing weight and maintaining a healthy weight can be a challenging and time-consuming process that requires a combination of diet and exercise. While there is no easy or "brain dead" way to lose weight, there are a few simple strategies that you can adopt to help you on your weight loss journey:

Eat more fruits and vegetables: Incorporating more fruits and vegetables into your diet can help you feel full and satisfied while also providing important nutrients. Aim for at least five servings of fruits and vegetables each day.

Drink plenty of water: Staying hydrated can help you feel full and may also help with weight loss. Aim to drink at least 8 cups (64 ounces) of water per day.

Get plenty of sleep: Adequate sleep is important for both physical and mental health. Aim for 7-9 hours of sleep per night.

Find an activity you enjoy: Regular physical activity can help with weight loss and maintenance, but it's important to find an activity that you enjoy. This could be walking, dancing, swimming, or any other activity that you find enjoyable.

Be consistent: Making small, consistent changes to your diet and exercise habits can help you see progress over time. Stick with it, even if you don't see results immediately.

It's important to remember that losing weight and maintaining a healthy weight requires a long-term commitment. There is no quick fix or easy solution. With patience and dedication, however, you can make progress towards your weight loss goals.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>27962875
How much of the maintenance can you do yourself?

i.e. do you know how to work with fiberglass? Could you rebuild a diesel engine with minimal help? Do you understand DC electrics? Are you prepared to ALWAYS be doing preventative maintenance? Can you tolerate the trade offs, like no onboard laundry/shower/etc?

It's totally feasible but it absolutely takes a certain type of person. The reality is that the main thing you need to worry about is the maintenance. You will never increase the value of the boat, but the work you put in will make it better to live on, better to sail, and prevent it from turning into a death trap. The more of that work you can/are willing to do yourself, the more likely you are to be suitable for the lifestyle.

Be the change you want to see, capitalism is quite good at solving problems.

Capitalism solved this problem in my community. Supermarkets collaborated with local food distribution centers and they buy that would-be discarded produce from stores at massively discounted rates for distribution to the poor, elderly, and homeless at food banks and churches. Volunteers sort through it to save the high quality items, so the final produce is of maximally high quality and is efficiently packed for speedy distribution. The local government, other charities, and the occasional fundraiser completely pay for it, because it's extremely price efficient care for the area relative to the government trying to do it themselves.

The professionals running the show are able to make a full-time salary ensuring this operation operates smoothy, the grocery stores don't waste food, the volunteers get to make a visible impact in the community, and the poor get fed - capitalism is a well-oiled machine capable of resolving this problem.

By comparison, every major "socialist" utopia's biggest export is starving, fleeing peasants - and the remains of the ones that couldn't get away.

Interviews are mainly about practice. Go on as many as you can. Drinking beforehand will make you more agreeable. Learn the rhythm of it, make sure you have questions for your interviewers at the end.

Every day, go out and apply in-person for a job. Digital applications or emails are easy to ignore, but make sure to do as many as possible so you can see the patterns.

If you’re not getting any interviews, there is something wrong. Your resume could be shitty, your social media might be a red flag, your town/city might be a shithole with no opportunities. No one stays unemployed without a reason.

Over the past 2 years, since I started working, I've just been slowly losing interest in everything, stopped playing video games, stopped keeping in touch with friends.
I realize that I don't even have it that bad because I work from home and save up most of my money. I'm glad I live with my parents and that I'm able to support them.
Other than that, my life is empty, there's really nothing I look forward to. All I think about is how much I dislike the work I do and how much time I'm wasting.
I feel like a stranger to myself and my family, barely speak, don't know what I want or who I am anymore. I almost feel like trying the therapy meme but it sounds like a scam and I risk tainting myself for the rest of my life if I say something wrong.
How can I turn things around or at least stop feeling like shit all the time?

/new/ was of course deleted because it had become /stormfront/, and was later restored as /pol/ along with /r9k/ because moot was a retard.
so yeah, the culture in /r9k/ shifted dramatically in response to elliot rodger in their terminology and memes, but the core of "incel alt right" culture existed on 4chan since at least 2009, it was just called something else, such as "MRA" and "stormfront". between 2012-2016 what happened was that /pol/ and /r9k/ and the antifeminism on /v/ spread out to all the other boards, and by 2016 it was everywhere.
but again, it came from within 4chan, it wasn't a foreign imposition.
and the "no sex before marriage, no porn" crap basically took off in 2018 when somebody made that coomer image and suddenly all these people who would freely admit to watching porn started rushing to prove that they weren't a coomer. literally, that meme by itself caused a seismic shift the popular attitudes around porn on the internet.

but that's just my recollection as a participant in these events.

>>27963964
>Where are the respectable zoomer women?
Red Cross.
Go volunteer at your local Red Cross.
If you have doubts, such as "doing stuff for free is for losers", you gain plenty, just not financially. Besides, it's all voluntary, you can go whenever you want, a friend of mine who has a job typically volunteers once or twice a month.
You gain a lot of knowledge and many skills through free courses and seminars, and also through working with people in general.
Probably the single most significant thing you gain: an ever-expanding network of people. If you show genuine interest and communicate with the people working at RC and the volunteers, you will either know a guy, or know a guy who knows a guy.
I've been volunteering for two years now, and met people from different places in my country and also other countries. I went to this place in a foreign country, beforehand I met a volunteer from their local RC, and went to their place and asked for some help after showing my volunteer card, they were more than welcoming.
We joke that it's like being a Freemason but without all that cultish nonsense.

Finally, to answer your question, you can meet respectable zoomer women at your local RC. It shouldn't be surprising; after all, we're there giving our free time to help people in need and improve ourselves in the process, instead of using our free time to binge the new season of a shitty netflix show.
Most volunteers at RC are women (no surprise there), and they're positively surprised every time a man shows up and joins the RC. (I met my gf a year ago at an RC meet up.)

Bottom line: No loses, only gains (including meeting good women).

posts.com:
>>27962762
> amongst the lowest they've ever been since records began.
You're statistically illiterate.
Crude divorce rates (divorces per unit population) have declined significantly from their peaks in the mid-20th century, but they are still well above, say, 19th-century counterparts. And this is mostly because the crude marriage rate has also declined significantly.

Relative divorce rates (i.e. the percent of marriages which end in divorce) are FAR higher than they were in the 19th century, and they've been pretty stagnant, at least in the US, since hitting their peak in the 70s. The issue with calculating relative divorce rates, I assume, is that you have to extrapolate. You don't have the ability to track every single marriage over time, so instead you have to use metrics like "percent of couples still together after X years" at a given point in time. It's important to make sure the methods are consistent between sources.
Regardless of method, though, looking at both the crude marriage and divorce rates over time (search "marriage vs divorce rates over time") makes it plain that the divorce rate remains quite high.

how do i stop fucking drinking?
had my fourth night in a row of drinking all of picrel. a week like this is not uncommon for me, and it's getting to be that i need something stronger as well.

posts.name: Over 3 years sober due to text below
posts.com:
Naltrexone for alcoholism treatment

An addict wanting and trying to quit is a case of the rational mind deciding to stop, while the autonomous processes of the mind create cravings. Its why people have such a hard time losing weight. Rational mind chooses to lose weight and eat less, autonomous mind sends craving signals. One can understand a behavior is worth quitting and try his best to quit, yet repeatedly fail against incessant, powerful urges. Worth noting is that gambling, sex, compulsive overeating, alcoholism and drug addiction are a cluster of similar disorders. A malfunction of the brain's "reward center". See for yourself: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18241634/

Naltrexone is a helpful medication to remove the cravings. Classed as an opiate-antagonist (binds to endorphin receptors w/out "high"), Naltrexone comes in a once-monthly injection or daily pills. Absent insurance, injection is expensive and pills are inexpensive. Public health clinics, aka "community clinics" receive federal and state cost-reduction grants to serve people who lack insurance. Sliding-fee scale for most services and in the case of Naltrexone injection, often free. In the U.S. you can call 211 in most cities, a direct line to United Way. They will help you locate such a clinic. Also some anti-depressants and other psychotropic medications can help. Addicts tend to have mood or other psychiatric issues that are called "co-morbid factors". A doctor at a "community clinic" can help with that also. Naltrexone is typically taken daily for 3+ months.

Drugs.com has 500+ positive reviews about Naltrexone from actual alcoholics.

"Medical detox" refers to a doctor prescribing librium or valium for a few days to get you safely off alcohol. It works and its painless. Trying to "taper down" WITH alcohol is slow and extremely painful. Most doctors will readily offer you a medical detox prescription.

>Tips for walking a mile in -15 F weather?
A mile is not far really. 10 miles? Then you better know your shit.
Bundle up.
Keep feet dry and warm.
Keep moving at steady pace, don't stop to rest.
Don't go too fast so you don't sweat.
Keep face covered with ski mask.
Keep hands in pockets.
Snowshoes if you need them. Otherwise they will slow you down.
Drink a couple big shots of whiskey or alcohol before you go if you want to stay warm during walk, or when you get to destination drink them then along with some water to help warm up your extremities (hands, feet, etc.)

Pardon this is pasted but here's what I know.
Apply for remote jobs. Apps like LinkedIn, ZipRecruiter and Kijiji have "remote only" checkboxes. So if you're in the US you can apply to jobs in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Seattle, wherever you want
Strong keywords for searching include "Inbound" "outbound" "remote". Data entry has gotten me a bunch of phishing emails and Indian men wanting me to download WhatsApp for job interviews, so watch out for those.

I have a call center job.
if you lack experience make it up by claiming your experience took place at a local business that you know is bankrupt so there would be no way for them to call the owner there and check on your past performance, just be reasonable, if you know a local Wendy's opened up in 2014 and shut down in 2018, they won't check or care if you put that on your resume. don't be too blatant. Here are a few tips that may help encourage your cat to eat dry food:

Transition slowly: If your cat is used to eating wet food, switching to dry food all at once may be a shock to their system. Instead, try gradually introducing the dry food over the course of a week or two. Mix a small amount of dry food in with their wet food at first, gradually increasing the amount of dry food as you go.

Make sure the food is fresh: Cats are sensitive to the smell and taste of their food, so if the dry food has been sitting around for a while, it may not be as appealing. Try using a sealable container to store the food and make sure to throw out any that has been left out for more than a few hours.
Offer a variety of flavors: Cats can get bored with the same food day after day, so try offering a variety of flavors and brands to keep things interesting.

Wet the food: Some cats may be more likely to eat dry food if it is moistened with a small amount of water or broth. This can also help to prevent dental problems that can be caused by dry food.

Consider adding some wet food: If your cat is still resistant to eating dry food, you may want to consider adding a small amount of wet food to their diet. This can help to entice them to eat the dry food and can also provide additional hydration.
It's important to remember that every cat is different and what works for one may not work for another. If you have tried these tips and your cat is still not interested in eating dry food, it may be worth consulting with your veterinarian for additional advice.

Weight is calories consumed vs Calories expended. Extra calories are stored as fat, and burning more calories than you eat causes the release of excess fat as your body uses it to create energy.
What you should do is look up a calorie calculator and then eat within that roughly while doing the bike exercising, and the monitor your weight daily
After two weeks you should start noticing a trend of your weight going down or up or maintaining, and you can add or subtract calories based on that.
Don't worry about day to day weight, your weight can fluctuate a few pounds randomly from sleep quality or shitting frequency or even stress but over weeks you can notice trends.

I've only ever made one recipe so I don't know what exactly would make them dry, but I can tell you what I do.
>mix panko chips, salt, and pepper in a flat dish
>flatten pork chops on a cutting board with your hands until they're about 1/2" thick
>salt and pepper both sides
>use a basting brush to cover them in sour cream
>lay in the panko mix and flip so that both sides get coated
>cook in a pan ~1/3" full of oil over medium heat, flip when the bottom is golden brown around the edges
>remove from pan, pat the excess grease off with paper towels
I also usually make some rice and dip the pieces of pork in tonkatsu sauce which is really good.

Try driving at night. (Not evening when everyone's headlights are in your eyes; late, late at night, when the whole world's asleep. Just make sure you're not sleepy.) Find a long and winding country road, dim the instrument panel, and just keep going. It's a whole different mood, very calming and just a little exciting. The sensory issues are attenuated, too, since there's nobody else around and you can't see any distractions outside what's illuminated in your headlights.

I got over my anxiety for driving and it can be done in specific ways. First please listen to this https://youtu.be/HI_yG-d6_vc?t=111 watch it atleast to 3:55 (its 2 minutes I ask of you total) it is very applicable here. Imagine that the speaker in this video is describing how to drive a car relaxed and confident.

This is the basis of building trust for yourself and what I describe to is handling responsibility of driving mostly from the conscious to the unconscious mind so that your conscious mind opens up and relaxes. You will get the sensation that you have a lot more processing power for every situation.

So now you are relaxed in your car, you may not be super skillful yet but thats nothing a little preparation cannot overcome. When I just started driving a car I studied all the routes intensely on google maps. Thats how I gave myself some extra support. All I had to do was focus on driving, and following my meticously planned route.

Over the years with many miles added up I feel more and more confident. Now I just pull up a GPS, and I always drive relaxed.

Let me know if this helps in any way I might think up some more things

It could be that she isn't interested in going on a date yet but doesn't want to express it because she doesn't know you that well yet and feels the need to be appeasing and not say anything that might be taken the wrong way or taken offense to. Just forget about the last conversation and message her with a conversation starter like a question about herself or another open ended question/statement. "How have you been doing lately?" "What are you planning to do this Christmas?" or thereforth

Saying that basically tosses the ball in her court and whether she wants to talk more to you is completely up to her and is clear. If she doesn't respond just sweat it off, it happens to the best of us.
